intro: Gaudichaudia mucronata, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It features a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. Gaudichaudia mucronata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
